Work.Name: Walmart Global Tech
Work.description:
- I was a Software Development Engineer II at Walmart, within the supply chain operations of Sam's Club. My primary focus was on Post-Fulfilment (Financials), and I played a key role in a modernization initiative that involved building a new Order Management System based on microservices architecture.
 - In this initiative, I led the modernization efforts for the invoicing service, catering to 69 million Sam's Club customers across the United States. The new system achieved a processing speed of 10,000 records per minute, significantly reducing accounting discrepancies from $44 million to $8 million. 
 - Over the span of two years, I contributed to various projects, including Healer Service, Distributed ID Generator, and State Machine for Order Orchestration. In addition to my technical involvement in multiple projects, I mentored four colleagues and received a Bravo Award for exceptional time management and collaboration skills in a fast-paced environment.

Projects.name: Sentiment Analysis by Transfer Learning [Python, Pytorch]
Projects.description: Designed a machine learning model using base BERT to classify Yelp reviews into positive, neutral, and negative. Achieved a F1 score of 0.87 on a highly unbalanced dataset. Approach:| 1. Classifier Design | 2. Parameter Tuning | 3. Layer Selection | 4. Unfreezing the Bert.

Projects.name: Capstone Matching Project [Ruby On Rails]
Projects.description:
The Capstone Matching process involves the process of matching students with suitable projects or clients based on their skills, interests, and the requirements of the project or client needs. Goal: Consolidate all parts of the Capstone Matching process into one place and reduce manual aspects. 
 Key Aspects: 
 1. Student Form: Students input their demographic information, resume (optional), and project ranking, so that they can be scored on these factors.
 2. Matching Process: Ranking students with appropriate projects based on criteria such as technical skills, expertise, project scope, student preferences, and sponsor restrictions/preferences. 
 3. Admin Control: Oversee the entire matching process: managing project listings, form submission timelines, handle user accounts (including student and faculty profiles), configure the matching algorithm. 
 4. Professor Dashboard: View the student's matching score for a particular project, view details of all the projects and submit projects preferences.

Projects.name: Chess Engine[C]
Projects.description: Programmed a chess engine using Min-Max Algorithm along with Alpha pruning. The engine could calculate next move at a depth of 5 using a combination of multiple data structures (Trees and Linked List).

Projects.name: Soccer Agent [Reinforcement Learning, Python]
Projects.description: Modeled a soccer agent for an 11 vs. 11 game for competition hosted by Google on Kaggle. The agent was trained using a reinforcement technique called Q-Learning and obtained a score of 952.

Projects.name: External Memory Merge Sort
Projects.description: EM Sort [C++]: Established an innovative solution to improve performance of binary merge by 200 M/s. Conducted a comparative analysis with existing algorithms, showcasing effectiveness of proposed approach.

Projects.name: Integration of Octave with HPCC [C++]
Projects.description: The objective of the internship project was to run octave scripts within ECL. (ECL is a ETL language built for HPCC Systems). To run the octave scripts, I spawned a octave interpreter within the HPCC Context. The project required understanding on working of octave, mapping between octave datatypes and ECL datatypes, ensuring thread safety of octave symbol table.
